Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice with start of cul; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of added red band at top of sherd and of two red bands at bottom; exterior: painted decoration consisting of undetermined motif at top left; below, two dilute lines above top of cul; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: 'Φ5' is written in pencil on the sherd's interior.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 20.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0978) (phase 2)
